snippet: Marwan Barghouti, a popular political figure and a convicted murderer serving multiple life sentences in Israel, could be an impetus to continue negotiations.
abstract: Marwan Barghouti, popular prisoner serving multiple life terms, has become the Palestinian parallel to Jonathan J Pollard, American convicted of spying for Israel whose potential release is also on the negotiating table to save the Middle East peace talks; both Israelis and Palestinians view the prisoners' release as part of peace process, but both bristle at the comparison between the two men.

byline.contributor: Said Ghazali contributed reporting from the West Bank, and Myra Noveck from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Marwan Barghouti, a popular political figure and a convicted murderer serving multiple life sentences in Israel, could be an impetus to continue negotiations.

headline.main: Prisoner in Israel Is Linked to Talks
headline.print_headline: Prisoner in Israel Is Linked to Talks
